lines.text: Let the law take these guys down. You know, sometimes the law works.
And Sometimes it doesn't! These people, they steal, they murder, they destroy people's lives and they get away with it! They have alibis, money, lawyers, power. They have everything.
Hey, Freddie! I'm gonna cure your dandruff problem, for you!
[Detonates Bomb]
[last lines]
Hey Lieutenant, if you need any help, give me a call.
[Olivia's factory at night, Reg is putting some pamphlets away when Tommy O'Shea, joined by Sal and Chuck Paconi arrive]
Reggie...
[Reg turns around, but before he can do anything, Sal and Chuck grab hold of him]
Little Reggie been telling tales and talking out of school, now who little Reggie been talking to?
I ain't said nothing to nobody but you, you piece of white-trash!
I had no idea you were so prejudice.
[Reg spits on Tommy's shoes]
I usually got a shine with that.

[to Sal and Chuck]
Do what you want with him.
[O'Shea begins walking towards the exit]
Reggie, there you go saying stupid things again.
Hey Sal.
You know Reggie, you're looking a little rumpled, whaddya say we straighten you out?
[Reg begins thrashing uncontrollably as Sal and Chuck drag him over to a shirt presser, all while the following is said]
No! No!
You don't want to go downtown looking like... not a good thing Reggie, not a good thing, now improve your appearance.
No! No! No! NO!
[Sal and Chuck close the shirt presser on Reg's left hand, steam rises up as Reg shouts in pain]
Man, that's gotta hurt!
[Sal and Chuck raise the shirt presser]
Reg, Reg, Reg, look we know you've been talking to somebody. Why don't you just tell us? Tell us who you've been talking to.
I didn't say nothing to nobody!
He didn't say 'nothing to nobody.'
Let's make it match his hand.
No! Nooo! NOOO!
[Sal and Chuck close the shirt presser, this time on Reg's right hand, more steam rises as Reg yells in pain, after a few seconds, they lift the shirt presser up again]
I bet that smarts, eh? Reg? *Reg?*
[Chuck grabs Reg's hat and throws it on the floor]
Why did you do it, *and don't lie to me!*
I said nothing to nobody!

[slapping Reg's forehead]
You lie! Let's straighten his hair.
No! No! NOOOO!
Come on! Come on!
[Sal and Chuck force Reg's head underneath the shirt presser]
Straighten his hair, eh?
[Sal and Chuck close the shirt presser on Reg's head; Reg continues to yell in pain]
Yeah, that's better.
[Sal and Chuck raise the shirt presser, Reg falls to the floor]
Well Reg, now you're all straightened out, say good night!
[Sal kicks Reg twice in the back, Reg grunts in pain, then Sal turns to Chuck]
Chickie, we'll meet you and Reg down in the car.
[Sal leaves as Chuck walks over to Reg]
Get up, get up!

[Reg weakly rises and looks at Chuck, who takes a Colt King Cobra from his pocket and points it at Reg's head. Reg struggles some more as he tries to get a better look. Chuck cocks the gun, and Reg continues struggling for a better look, all while groaning]
Good night, Reg.
[Chuck fires the gun]
[Tommy O'Shea has just finished administering Al his weight loss, Reg runs over to Tommy]
This is bullshit!
What's that? What's that man?
It's bullshit! So are you!
Hey man! What makes you the head nigger and you talk to me like that?
Fuck you, you son of a...
Heeyyy!
[Sal and Chuck grab Reg, Sal takes out a knife]
Reg, that was really stupid. You've got a big mouth, now apologize to the man.
I ain't saying shit!
Ah now, Reggie. You know damn well if you don't say shit, you lose ninety percent of your vocabulary.
[Reg defiantly spites on O'Shea shoes, O'Shea gives him a surprised look]
You people just never learn, do you?
[Sal slashes Reg's cheek with the knife]
Mr. O'Shea... Mr. O'Shea...

[Pulling Al by his necktie]
That's my name.
Mr. O'Shea is this...
You're repeating yourself.
Is this necessary?
You're boring the shit out of me. You know what your problem is? *You know what your problem is?*

[choking]
What?

You and your boss think you don't have to service your partners anymore. Let me tell you something, I'm partnered up with over 35 companies, all of them are very responsive and very helpful. With the exception of this company, because this company is too fat. And you, *you're too fat!*
[Tommy pushes Al onto a table where he is restrained by Sal and Chuck]
Look at you, you look like a beached whale.
Mr. O'Shea...
Al, Al, I tried to warn you didn't I, you wouldn't listen.
[Tommy picks up a nearby saw and turns it on, upon seeing the saw, Al begins struggling]
Look what we have here!
[Tommy moves the saw closer to Al's stomach, but he suddenly turns it off]
Just acting, just acting Albert, relax.

[lifting up Al's shirt]
Oh seriousness, my god!
That's gross.
Big tub of guts. I think you oughta have Dr. O'Shea's one second weight loss.
[O'Shea turns the saw back on as Al begins struggling again, but Sal quickly restrains him. Chuck takes out a gun and points it at Al's head]
No! No!
Don't move fat man!
[Reg notices what is happening, and walks over to the scene]
I think Al's got the message here don't you Al? Huh? Don't you? Well don't you?
[Tommy cuts into the side of Al's stomach with the saw, Al screams loudly as he rolls over a little. Tommy turns off the saw as he, Sal, and Chuck back away to avoid the blood]

[Points gun to O'Shea]
Guns make you nervous?

[Over walkie talkie]
I'm coming for you, O'Shea.
No judge, no jury, no appeals, no deals.
Wait! Whatever you want. Whatever you need.
I don't need anything. But *you*. You need a bath!
[Pushes him into a vat of liquid plastic]

[Looking in the mirror]
Tell me, Paul, what do you see?
I see the women I'm going to marry.
[Night, Paul Kersey is sitting on a bed with a doll in his hand, when Hector Vasquez enters the room, Paul sees him through a mirror, he has a gun in his hand]
I didn't think it would be this easy, Kersey.
[Kersey suddenly turns around with a revolver in hand and shoots Vasquez twice in the chest, Vasquez falls to the floor]
Neither did I.

[pointing a gun at Paul]
You got a problem?
Guns make you nervous?
Guns have their uses. Idiots with guns make me nervous.
[In the Paconi Family restaurant, Paul has just poisoned Chuck Paconi, who is sitting down, making horrible gagging and choking sounds]
You got a problem?
[Chuck looks up at Paul, still choking. Paul pushes Chuck's face onto the table and then walks out of the restaurant]
[Tommy O'Shea is taking his daughter with him, he tosses some papers at Paul, while Sal and Chuck Paconi look on]
Read 'em and weep, she's coming with me.
Like hell she is.
[Paul punches Tommy, but Sal and Chuck grab Paul and hit him from behind with a log, knocking him unconscious, Sal and Chuck then proceed to help Tommy get up]
Son of a bitch is quick.
[Tommy, Sal, and Chuck leave the house]
